intro: Camissonia californica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and open woodlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Camissonia californica is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
